abstract.p: Wieden & Kennedy takes top honors with two awards, including $100,000 prize for general excellence, at annual Kelly Awards, competition sponsored by Magazine Publishers of America; some other winners noted (Advertising column) (S)

block.p: Wieden & Kennedy in Portland, Ore., took top honors with two awards, including the $100,000 prize for general excellence, at the 19th annual Kelly Awards competition sponsored by the Magazine Publishers of America.

At a ceremony last night in Chicago to honor the best creative campaigns in magazines in 1999, Wieden & Kennedy won for a campaign for AltaVista, the Internet search engine, carrying the theme ''Smart is beautiful.''

Wieden & Kennedy in Portland, Ore., took top honors with two awards, including the $100,000 prize for general excellence, at the 19th annual Kelly Awards competition sponsored by the Magazine Publishers of America.

At a ceremony last night in Chicago to honor the best creative campaigns in magazines in 1999, Wieden & Kennedy won for a campaign for AltaVista, the Internet search engine, carrying the theme ''Smart is beautiful.''
In addition to general excellence, the work also won an award for best at meeting the objectives of a campaign.

The award for best design and graphics went to Crispin Porter & Bogusky in Miami for a campaign for Giro Sport Design. And the prize for best headline and copy was given to Carmichael Lynch in Minneapolis, part of the Interpublic Group of Companies, for work for Harley-Davidson motorcycles.
The winners were chosen from 25 finalists selected by creative directors at agencies nationwide.
